newsitem.title: USA: FLAG Financial sees charge causing Q3 loss.
newsitem.headline: FLAG Financial sees charge causing Q3 loss.

text.p: FLAG Financial Corp said it wholly owned unit, First Federal Savings Bank of LaGrange, expects to take a $2.3 million charge against its third quarter earnings related to a portfolio of equipment leases sold to the bank.
The company said this charge will result in the bank reporting a net loss for the third quarter.

FLAG said the portfolio of leases was sold to the bank through the Bennett Funding Group Inc. Bennett Funding has recently filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, and as a result, its collection of cash flows and the values associated with these leases have become less certain, FLAG said.
FLAG said it has recognized a special provision of $678,000 in the second quarter to recognize this possible loss in book value.

It said that after further review and consultation with regulatory authorities and advisers, it was determined that FLAG should add an additional special provision of $2.3 million in the third quarter to the $678,000 recognized in the second quarter.
